# aws-cognito-auth-example

You will learn the following:
1. Authenticate via AWS Congnito
2. Authorize via AWS 
3. Use JWT token for auth

# How to run
```shell
node app.js
```

## Pre-requisite

# APIs

### Login response
```shell
{
    "message": "Login successful",
    "accessToken": "eyJraWQiOiJnYWJTdFFPYU40NVVjWGNHVnMxWkI5R1JFckpWZCtybDZjSDl3eDg0d2ZNPSIsImFsZyI6IlJTMjU2In0..QEwaWOKp8oHmoJagw5grW9I9u3SdltdtZBFne4AnxtOssBKPnOsfGTuDSp9zT2Sy9py-veqcLvVZg6N4JwM6r_m2Mp2a_8G6i8Y-weLyjwuK3KGAX_GloD9EmaciOEHPwaH_7caRGdv_NaZxx3k_7N3B_3rBAhcamkgV-kGGPE9V8IkVEYLL-4yq7_MNki2SoXZtG9WAF-jyrTs97WzfWZ-kkQ0OMcEnVkCaej6hyaUF5xFiV5ccxwds852PcT6h8jf7DhFxn3qoGa9unyVGuGh795PEIVcpZWBrqDG5E0SblwZ1ErgSyIvd7-q6P9Kc7-qWXP_9mXJ2tMRV0o3d7A"
```
